title: New Report Finds Retail Energy Key to an Affordable Clean Energy Transition - PR Newswire
summary: A new report suggests that competitive energy markets in the US are more beneficial to consumers than traditional monopoly models. These markets offer greater consumer choice, contribute to clean energy development, and foster innovation, ultimately leading to lower overall energy costs. The report recommends improving consumer education and protections to ensure the full potential of these markets is realized.
product_or_process: 100% renewable energy plans, electric vehicle charging plans

title: Hart Energy's 2023 ESG Awards: Cleaner, Safer, More Diverse - Hart Energy
summary: This article highlights companies in the oil and gas industry that are making progress in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) performance. It analyzes their efforts in reducing emissions, promoting community engagement, and fostering a positive workplace culture, awarding points based on these metrics. The article features examples like Pioneer Natural Resources for its methane reduction efforts, Talos Energy for its offshore CO₂ sequestration project, and Baker Hughes for its investments in renewable energy sources.
product_or_process: Methane reduction through facility design, operations and leak-management protocols
greenwashing: The article doesn't provide evidence of greenwashing, instead highlighting companies' genuine efforts to improve their environmental performance.

title: EconiQ retrofill: the sustainable solution that reduces reliance on SF₆ - Hitachi Energy
summary: SF6 is a powerful greenhouse gas used in the energy sector, particularly in high-voltage equipment. While leakage rates are low, the need to minimize or replace SF6 is recognized due to its high global warming potential. The main challenge is the lack of viable alternatives to SF6.

title: Inside the 'supermarket of the future' promising to waste less energy and less food - FoodNavigator.com
summary: Danfoss has opened a 'Smart Store' supermarket in Nordborg, Denmark, showcasing energy-efficient solutions for food retail. The store utilizes solar power, heat recovery from refrigeration systems, and advanced controls to achieve a 50% energy efficiency gain compared to traditional supermarkets. Danfoss hopes to inspire other retailers to adopt these solutions, aiming to reduce emissions and combat food waste.

title: New system design for PVT systems coupled with air-to-water reversible heat pump - pv magazine International
summary: Researchers at the University of Zaragoza have developed a hybrid solar energy system using PVT panels integrated with an air-to-water heat pump. The system is designed to provide heating, cooling, domestic hot water, and electricity to industrial buildings. This system was tested in a real-world pilot plant at an industrial facility in Zaragoza, demonstrating its potential for energy self-sufficiency in non-residential buildings.
product_or_process: Photovoltaic-Thermal (PVT) system integrated with an air-to-water heat pump

title: 4 technology trends driving sustainability in real estate - The Times of India
summary: The article discusses the adoption of technology in India's real estate sector to promote sustainability, particularly in response to rising energy demands. It highlights key innovations like smart building systems, renewable energy solutions, green construction technologies, and AI-powered tools that are reducing carbon footprints, optimizing energy consumption, and promoting eco-friendly practices within the industry. Despite challenges such as initial cost and lack of awareness, the article emphasizes the significant potential of these technologies to transform the real estate landscape in India and contribute to a more sustainable future.

title: Breweries' leftovers brew up a storm: transforming waste into wealth - Innovation Origins
summary: The beer brewing industry is finding innovative ways to repurpose waste, transforming it into valuable resources. Research has focused on using brewery waste as a substrate for growing protein-rich fungi, which can be used as food. Additionally, spent yeast is being upcycled into a nutritious flour for food production, offering a potential alternative protein source. These innovations are leading to a circular economy in the brewing industry, reducing waste and contributing to sustainability.

title: Direct lithium extraction: The companies at play (part 2/2) - ShareCafe
summary: This article explores direct lithium extraction (DLE) technology, a method that aims to extract lithium from brine without the use of traditional evaporation ponds. The article highlights various companies, both Australian and international, that are using or developing DLE technology, including Lilac Solutions, EnergyX, and Sunresin New Materials, among others. The article also discusses the potential environmental and economic advantages of DLE, focusing on its potential to reduce water usage and energy consumption compared to traditional lithium extraction methods.

title: Niger Delta Exploration & Production PLC to unveil new brand identity - TheCable
summary: Niger Delta Exploration & Production Plc (NDEP), a Nigerian oil and gas company, is unveiling a new brand identity, reflecting its commitment to becoming a leading African provider of sustainable energy solutions. NDEP aims to address Nigeria's energy deficit by improving access to affordable and sustainable energy, focusing on the production and distribution of gas, the transition fuel towards net zero emissions. The company also plans to explore technologies that harness diverse energy sources in Nigeria and West Africa, creating a sustainable and affordable energy bouquet.
product_or_process: Sustainable energy solutions and gas as a transition fuel

title: Exclusive: Anand Group opens new tech centre in Gurugram under Anevolve-Headspring JV - Autocar Professional
summary: Anand Group, an Indian automotive major, has launched a new technology center called Anevolve Headspring Engineering Centre (ANHS) in partnership with Japanese sustainable energy solutions provider Headspring. The center will focus on developing advanced power electronics solutions for clean mobility applications, including EV powertrains, converters, and chargers. ANHS plans to develop a range of chargers for electric two-, three-, and four-wheelers, as well as BLDC controllers for consumer electronics.
product_or_process: on-board chargers and invertors for electric vehicles
